article.description:
Zach Randolph typified Portland's inside success
in the second half by scoring all 16 of his points in the final two
quarters to lead the Trail Blazers past the Dallas Mavericks 100-93
Sunday.

related.description: What happened between an irate Rasheed Wallace and a ref? It depends on whom you talk to.
related.linkText: Aldridge: The truth is out there
related.title: What really happened between ref, Rasheed

related.description:
A Monday court hearing in Washington state
for Trail Blazers Damon Stoudamire and Rasheed Wallace, cited in
late November for misdemeanor marijuana possession, has been
rescheduled for Feb. 18.
related.linkText: Hearing rescheduled for Blazers' Wallace, Stoudamire
related.title: Wallace, Stoudamire have pleaded innocent to charges
related.headline: Wallace, Stoudamire have pleaded innocent to charges

article.headline: Randolph scores 16 second-half points in Blazers' win
article.linkText: Randolph, Portland use inside muscle to defeat Mavs
article.story:
DALLAS (AP) -- With one big guy after another fighting his way to the basket, the Portland Trail Blazers showed the Dallas Mavericks a gritty way to win.
Randolph

Zach Randolph typified Portland's inside success in the second half by scoring all 16 of his points in the final two quarters, leading the Trail Blazers past the Mavericks 100-93 Sunday. Portland erased an early 14-point deficit by working the ball low and pounding away. The Trail Blazers scored 52 points in the paint and scored another 22 on free throws. They also had 16 more rebounds than Dallas, which lost at home for the first time since Dec. 30 against Milwaukee. "They did a good job taking us to the basket,'' Mavericks guard Steve Nash said. "They did a good job of penetrating and getting inside our defense.'' Dallas' finesse style worked early when the outside shots were falling. Then the Blazers made some halftime adjustments and the Mavs couldn't recover. Portland held Dallas to 13 third-quarter points and forced Dirk Nowitzki to go nearly 20 minutes between baskets. The Blazers also pestered the Mavericks into making nine second-half turnovers. "We stepped up our defense in the second half and that really got us going,'' said Bonzi Wells, who had 18 points and tied his career high with 14 rebounds. "Dallas has the best team in the league right now, and we had to adjust to them. We had to step up for the win.'' Scottie Pippen had 19 points, Derek Anderson had 17 -- going 4-of-5 on 3-pointers -- and Ruben Patterson added 12 as Portland won its fourth straight, all on the road. The Blazers are 4-1 since leading scorer and rebounder Rasheed Wallace was suspended seven games for threatening referee Tim Donaghy after a victory over Memphis on Jan. 15. "This is great for us, especially with the absence of Rasheed,'' Pippen said. "We've responded well and have answered the challenges. We're responding in a way that makes people think of us as a basketball team and not with all that off-the-court stuff.'' Randolph has made his first five career starts in place of Wallace. In his two previous games, he racked up his first career double-double and scored a career-best 20 points. He started this one 0-for-2 in 13 first-half minutes, then got rolling with a dunk on the Blazers' second possession of the third quarter. He had a run of six straight points midway through the third, then in the fourth made two 3-point plays and later had a nice tip-in of his own miss. "He has a really good low-post game,'' Dallas coach Don Nelson said. "We did a good job on him until the second half. He got some openings, mostly second shots. They dominated us on the boards.'' Wells credited Randolph for shutting down Nowitzki, who had only two points in the second half. He finished with 13, nearly 10 below his average. "Zach had to just play him and get up in him,'' Wells said. Portland tied the game on a jumper by Pippen with 2:27 left in the third, then took the lead on a layup by Wells. The Blazers didn't trail again en route to winning for the ninth time in their last 11 road games. Portland now has 15 road wins, tying Dallas for the most in the NBA. The Blazers' previous two games went a total of three OT periods. Michael Finley had 27 points to lead the Mavericks, who had won three straight. Raef LaFrentz came off the bench to produce 19 points, seven rebounds and four blocks. Steve Nash had 15 points and nine assists. Dallas made 14 of its first 20 shots, getting assists on 11 of them. Over the last three quarters, the Mavs were 21-of-56 (38 percent) with only 11 more assists. They also hurt themselves by missing six free throws in the final 5:10. The league's most accurate team from the line (83.8 percent) went 15-of-23, a season-low 65 percent. Game notes
Donaghy was one of the officials working the game. Among his calls was a technical foul on Nelson. Portland coach Maurice Cheeks also got a technical. ... The Blazers ended a three-game losing streak to the Mavericks. ... Dallas' 13 points in the third quarter was its fewest in that period this season. ... During Nowitzki's drought, the Mavs went from 13 up to three down. He had such an off game that he lost control of his dribble -- during a free-throw attempt.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
